body_html:
And by this I mean that if you send a PR which implements this in terms of other ops I'll happily accept it.
…
On Fri, Jul 27, 2018 at 8:17 AM Alexandre Passos ***@***.***> wrote: I think you can just write the python code and get the same performance in this case, without having to write new C++ kernels, which add to the complexity, maintenance cost, and binary size of tensorflow. On Thu, Jul 26, 2018 at 7:50 PM Ethan Brooks ***@***.***> wrote: > Wait, @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> there are lots of tensorflow > ops that can be implemented in terms of existing ops (e.g. expand_dims). > But implementing repeat is a hassle, prone to errors, and not easily > readable. Please clarify why this merge request is getting rejected? > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#18350 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxR3y0hXcKo_77csZnhYkyTCKVK2zks5uKn_agaJpZM4TM5ar> > . > -- - Alex
-- - Alex
body_text:
And by this I mean that if you send a PR which implements this in terms of
other ops I'll happily accept it.
…
On Fri, Jul 27, 2018 at 8:17 AM Alexandre Passos ***@***.***> wrote:
 I think you can just write the python code and get the same performance in
 this case, without having to write new C++ kernels, which add to the
 complexity, maintenance cost, and binary size of tensorflow.

 On Thu, Jul 26, 2018 at 7:50 PM Ethan Brooks ***@***.***>
 wrote:

> Wait, @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> there are lots of tensorflow
> ops that can be implemented in terms of existing ops (e.g. expand_dims).
> But implementing repeat is a hassle, prone to errors, and not easily
> readable. Please clarify why this merge request is getting rejected?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#18350 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxR3y0hXcKo_77csZnhYkyTCKVK2zks5uKn_agaJpZM4TM5ar>
> .
>


 --
  - Alex


-- 
 - Alex
body:
And by this I mean that if you send a PR which implements this in terms of
other ops I'll happily accept it.

On Fri, Jul 27, 2018 at 8:17 AM Alexandre Passos <apassos@google.com> wrote:

> I think you can just write the python code and get the same performance in
> this case, without having to write new C++ kernels, which add to the
> complexity, maintenance cost, and binary size of tensorflow.
>
> On Thu, Jul 26, 2018 at 7:50 PM Ethan Brooks <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
>> Wait, @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> there are lots of tensorflow
>> ops that can be implemented in terms of existing ops (e.g. expand_dims).
>> But implementing repeat is a hassle, prone to errors, and not easily
>> readable. Please clarify why this merge request is getting rejected?
>>
>> —
>> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/18350#issuecomment-408295099>,
>> or mute the thread
>> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxR3y0hXcKo_77csZnhYkyTCKVK2zks5uKn_agaJpZM4TM5ar>
>> .
>>
>
>
> --
>  - Alex
>


-- 
 - Alex
